transcript: "Executive Summary  : Data Bridge Market Research analyses that the global power-packed liquid vitamin market will project a CAGR of 6.00% for the forecast period of 2021-2028. The global power-packed liquid vitamin market is highly segmented based on type, end-user, and distribution channel. Single vitamin liquid supplements and multivitamin liquid supplements cater to different consumer needs and preferences. The market targets various consumer groups including adults, seniors, and children, offering tailored products to meet their specific requirements. Companies like Pfizer Inc., Herbalife Nutrition Ltd., and Amway have a strong presence in the market, offering a wide range of liquid vitamin products to meet consumer demands. Other key players such as Bayer AG, Nestlé, and GNC Holdings also contribute significantly to the market dynamics with innovative product offerings and strategic marketing initiatives. Furthermore, companies like Nu Skin Enterprises, Inc., Blackmores, and Forever Living.com are gaining traction in the market with a focus on quality and sustainability. Nature's Sunshine Products, Inc. is another noteworthy player known for its commitment to natural ingredients and product efficacy. The global power-packed liquid vitamin market is experiencing significant growth due to the rising consumer awareness regarding health and wellness, especially in light of the ongoing pandemic. With a focus on preventive healthcare and overall wellbeing, the demand for liquid vitamin supplements is on the rise across various consumer segments. In response to this trend, market players are innovating their product offerings to cater to specific demographic groups such as adults, seniors, and children. Customized formulations targeting the unique nutritional needs of each segment are gaining traction in the market. One key trend influencing the market is the shift towards natural and organic ingredients in liquid vitamin supplements. Consumers are increasingly seeking products that are free from artificial additives, preservatives, and synthetic ingredients. This trend is driving market players to source high-quality, natural ingredients for their formulations, enhancing the overall appeal of their products to health-conscious consumers. Companies like Forever Living.com and Nature's Sunshine Products, Inc. are particularly well-positioned to capitalize on this trend with their focus on natural and sustainable ingredients. Another important aspect shaping the market is the distribution channel landscape. The increasing popularity of online retail channels for purchasing health and wellness products is creating new opportunities for market players to expand their reach and accessibility. The convenience of online shopping, coupled with a wider product assortment, is driving consumers towards e-commerce platforms for their liquid vitamin supplement needs. Traditional brick-and-mortar retailers such as pharmacies and supermarkets/hypermarkets are also evolving their strategies to enhance the in-store shopping experience and attract customers. Overall, the global power-packed liquid vitamin market is poised for continued growth in the coming years, driven by factors such as increasing health consciousness, demographic trends, and evolving consumer preferences. Market players will need to focus on product innovation, quality assurance, and effective marketing strategies to stay competitive in this dynamic market landscape....

transcript: Supplements are NOT approved by the FDA before hitting store shelves. Unlike medications, companies don't have to prove they're safe or effective. ❌ Contamination with heavy metals ❌ Undeclared prescription drugs ❌ Wrong doses or fake ingredients ❌ Hidden stimulants or banned substances ❗This isn't rare — it's happening right now in products you can buy at Walmart, Amazon, or GNC. OxyElite Pro – Linked to liver failure and pulled after reports of death. Hydroxycut – Caused seizures and liver damage, recalled in 2009. Ephedra (Ma Huang) – Connected to over 100 deaths, finally banned in 2004. Kratom – Still legal, despite causing addiction and fatal overdoses. ARIIX Rejuveniix – Contained hidden pharmaceutical drugs. These were all sold legally until people got hurt. ❗Just because it's on a store shelf doesn't mean it's safe. The FDA does not test or approve supplements before they're sold — and some have caused liver failure, heart attacks, and even death. Scary? It should be. Here's how to stay safe: Look for THIRD-PARTY TESTING. Since the FDA doesn't regulate supplements for safety, third-party testing is your only real way to know: ✅ What's actually in the bottle ✅ That it doesn't contain harmful contaminants ✅ That the dose matches the label ✅ That it's free from banned or hidden substances Trusted Third-Party Seals to Look For: NSF Certified for Sport USP Verified ConsumerLab Informed Choice If your supplement doesn't have any of these? That's a red flag ✨ Bottom Line: Not all supplements are bad — but many are untested, contaminated, or outright dangerous. Do your homework, ask questions, and only buy products that are third-party tested. Follow me for specific brand and supplement recs! #supplements #nutritionist #educateyourself #safesupplements #nutritionistapproved #makeamericahealthyagain #proteinpowder #vitaminsupplements

transcript: Classified in: Health Subject: PDT SADDLE BROOK, N.J., July 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Mira's Harvest, the Caribbean rooted herbal wellness brand behind the viral soursop bitters movement, has officially launched in 256 GNC stores across the United States and Puerto Rico, marking the brand's first major national retail rollout. The in-store debut features the brand's best selling Mango Soursop Bitters, a tropical spin on its signature bitter detox tonic that has taken TikTok by storm. Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. To now see our bitters on GNC shelves is proof that people are ready for real healing." The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. Media Contact: Angela Brooks 2015035854 [email protected] SOURCE Mira's Harvest News published on 3 july 2025 at 08:42 and distributed by

transcript: SADDLE BROOK, N.J., July 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/   Mira's Harvest, the Caribbean rooted herbal wellness brand behind the viral soursop bitters movement, has officially launched in 256 GNC stores across the United States and Puerto Rico, marking the brand's first major national retail rollout. The in-store debut features the brand's best selling Mango Soursop Bitters, a tropical spin on its signature bitter detox tonic that has taken TikTok by storm. Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. To now see our bitters on GNC shelves is proof that people are ready for real healing." The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. Media  : Angela Brooks 2015035854

transcript: SADDLE BROOK, N.J., July 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Mira's Harvest, the Caribbean rooted herbal wellness brand behind the viral soursop bitters movement, has officially launched in 256 GNC stores across the United States and Puerto Rico, marking the brand's first major national retail rollout. The in-store debut features the brand's best selling Mango Soursop Bitters, a tropical spin on its signature bitter detox tonic that has taken TikTok by storm. Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. To now see our bitters on GNC shelves is proof that people are ready for real healing." The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. Media Contact: Angela Brooks 2015035854 397510@email4pr.com View original content to download multimedia:https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/caribbean-herbal-wellness-goes-mainstream-viral-brand-miras-harvest-launches-in-256-gnc-stores-302496799.html SOURCE Mira's Harvest

cleaned_transcript: SADDLE BROOK, N.J., July 3, 2025 /PRNewswire/ -- Mira's Harvest, the Caribbean rooted herbal wellness brand behind the viral soursop bitters movement, has officially launched in 256 GNC stores across the United States and Puerto Rico, marking the brand's first major national retail rollout. The in-store debut features the brand's best selling Mango Soursop Bitters, a tropical spin on its signature bitter detox tonic that has taken TikTok by storm. Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. To now see our bitters on GNC shelves is proof that people are ready for real healing." The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. The in-store debut features the brand's best selling Mango Soursop Bitters, a tropical spin on its signature bitter detox tonic that has taken TikTok by storm. Known for its bold taste and plant powered formula, the bitters support digestion, reduce bloating, and promote internal balance without synthetic ingredients. "This is more than a shelf placement, it's a moment," said founder Theo Edwards. "We took ancient Caribbean herbs that my grandmother used and built something modern, effective, and rooted in wisdom. To now see our bitters on GNC shelves is proof that people are ready for real healing." The Mango Soursop Bitters blend includes powerful ingredients like soursop leaf, sea moss, burdock root, ginger, and African mango. The flavor forward formula has quickly become a go to for gut health seekers and detox enthusiasts across TikTok, Amazon, and retail. With over 256 stores carrying the product and six figure monthly revenue across TikTok Shop, Amazon, and wholesale channels, Mira's Harvest is one of the only Caribbean founded wellness brands available in major U.S. retail. The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. Media Contact: Angela Brooks 2015035854 397510.com View original content to download multimedia: SOURCE Mira's Harvest

The launch signals a new era of culturally rooted herbal products entering the mainstream. Mira's Harvest Mango Soursop Bitters is now available in select GNC stores throughout the U.S. and Puerto Rico, and online at GNC.com. The company also plans to launch a 15 day herbal cleanse and soursop capsule line later this year. Media Contact: Angela Brooks 2015035854 397510.com View original content to download multimedia: SOURCE Mira's Harvest

transcript: Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules “Partnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,” said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. “They're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.” Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats—from resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks  Classic and Caramel Himalayan Shilajit Gummies  Mango Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules “Partnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,” said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. “They're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.” Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats—from resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. Contact Person's Name: Akash Dhoot Organization / Company: BetterAlt Company website: thebetteralt.com Contact Email Address: press@thebetteralt.com City, State / Province, Country, Zip Code: Dover, Delaware, 19904 A photo accompanying this announcement is available at

transcript: Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules “Partnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,” said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. “They're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.” Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats—from resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. transcript: BetterAlt's latest retail expansion is placing its Ayurvedic-inspired wellness products in 425 Sprouts Farmers Market locations across the U.S., reinforcing consumer demand for natural supplements that combine traditional remedies with modern science-backed formulations. Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules “Partnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,” said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. “They're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.” Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats—from resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. transcript: Off Tirz after loosing 35lbs in 6 weeks. 220lbs to 185lbs wanted to see what the hype was with Reta even though I'm almost at my goal weight of 170 lbs. Just started Reta a few weeks ago current stack is Reta 1mg  1x week CCJ/ipa 500mcg daily before bed AOD 500mcg daily morning or before workout Tesofensine 500mcg tablet AM daily KLOW 4-6 mg 2-3 X daily MT2 250-500mcg weekly maintenance It's ALOT of pinning and rotating injection sites Running 20+ miles weekly Weight training 3-5 days Current diet is 10oz meals I buy 50 packs of 12oz food prep containers off Amazon. They're really small. Usually make 15 to 20 meals for the week for the wife and I. 1x eggs bacons sausage potatoes bell peppers 2x Brown rice, meat protein, broccoli, yams 2x protein BCAA 1x GNC mega men whole body multivitamins 1 gal water daily 4 LMNT packets or just pink salt and lemon.

transcript: BetterAlt's latest retail expansion is placing its Ayurvedic-inspired wellness products in 425 Sprouts Farmers Market locations across the U.S., reinforcing consumer demand for natural supplements that combine traditional remedies with modern science-backed formulations. Photo Courtesy of: BetterAlt DOVER, Del., July 03, 2025 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BetterAlt, a rising leader in Ayurvedic and science-backed wellness, has officially partnered with Sprouts Farmers Market to make its best-selling products available in 425 locations across the United States. The collaboration significantly expands BetterAlt's reach in physical retail, offering Sprouts customers convenient access to a curated line of natural supplements formulated for energy, performance, and holistic wellness. The initial rollout includes BetterAlt's most in-demand products: Himalayan Shilajit Resin Himalayan Shilajit Honey Sticks (Classic and Caramel) Himalayan Shilajit Gummies (Mango) Himalayan Shilajit Capsules Tongkat Ali Cordyceps Capsules Shilajit Sea Moss Capsules “Partnering with Sprouts is an exciting milestone for us,” said Akash Dhoot, cofounder at BetterAlt. “They're known for putting quality and transparency first - values we care deeply about. Together, we're making it easier for people to bring time-tested, nature-based wellness into their daily lives.” Founded on the principles of Ayurveda and enhanced by modern science, BetterAlt's products are third-party lab tested at ISO-certified laboratories and formulated to support energy, stamina, cognitive performance, and daily vitality. The company has quickly gained momentum on digital platforms, including Amazon and TikTok, selling over 15 million servings of Himalayan Shilajit and 1.5 million customers within its first year of operations. The launch into Sprouts stores is part of BetterAlt's broader growth strategy to increase accessibility in high-traffic wellness retail channels while continuing to innovate in functional nutrition. With a focus on consumer trust and quality assurance, the brand is helping reshape how ancient remedies are adopted in modern lifestyles. About BetterAlt BetterAlt is a global health and wellness company blending traditional Ayurvedic wisdom with modern science to develop natural supplements for today's fast-paced world. Best known for its Himalayan Shilajit-based products, BetterAlt offers functional wellness in various consumer-friendly formats—from resins and capsules to gummies and honey sticks. The company has experienced rapid growth, achieving $100 million in annual revenue and 5x the growth rate. Recognized among the top 3 health brands on TikTok Shop, BetterAlt's products consistently rank #1 on Amazon in their categories and are also available through major retailers like GNC. Headquartered in the United States, the company currently serves markets across North America, Asia, and Europe. Contact Information: Contact Person's Name : Akash Dhoot Organization / Company: BetterAlt Company website: thebetteralt.com Contact Email Address: press@thebetteralt.com City, State / Province, Country, Zip Code: Dover , Delaware, 19904 A photo accompanying this announcement is available at https://www.globenewswire.com/NewsRoom/AttachmentNg/cd3d37a7-ebf7-48fd-b0f4-d1932aa8fa6d

transcript: I completely agree with everyone's comments. When I got the new packaging, I thought it was just cosmetic. It turns out that it doesn't mix worth a dam, the sediment that is left is literally salt (I have chewed the leftover pieces and they are absolutely coarse salt), and the flavor is much worse. I can only tolerate chocolate flavored shakes, but I don't think the other flavors will be any different. I have had an Amazon subscription for isopure for a couple of years now, which I have since canceled. I'm returning my last container. My focus is carbohydrates. Isopure had a net zero carb for the chocolate flavor, which was fantastic. The closest match I have found is from GNC advanced muscle performance pure isolate chocolate lava cake. It has only two net carbs and only 15 more calories per serving, which is the best I can find so far. I did see isopure unflavored, which has zero carbs and lower calories. I haven't tried it yet. If I can't choke it down, I'm going to have to go with the pure isolate from GNC. I don't want to do that, because it's more calories, carbs, and is noticeably more expensive. Does anyone know how we can provide feedback directly to the company?

transcript: I buy NAC ethyl ester from lipmaxmall on Amazon. It's cheap, and it works. So many supplements are scams, be careful. The ethyl ester part is good, and I had a doctor do bloodwork, and he said my growth hormone was at a good high level, and I said what?? Lol, I'm 50. He said its from the NAC, so.I.know that is good. Dose is , according to my specialists,  at least 1800mg per day to have any effect. So I take 1 pill am, 1 pill pm. But some take it 3x a day and thats ok. I also take NAD , Coq10, and pro resolving mediators from Thorne brand. Super pricey, and there's probably others. Once per day.
